Going by present count, this will be Portal Review #29,085...but considering I am STILL leaving this review...fully expecting it to actually be read by more than two people (including myself), I plan on describing this game's dynamics, pro's and con's in a way that hasn't been already typed out in 60-14,000 other reviews.  
Yes, I am JUST THAT narcissistic. In fact, my entry here on how I see the Portal experience is so superior, it is most likely that the next 1,400 readers (at least) will read my review...be shaken to the core in an almost religious experience upon reading my review that they will just stop reading there and just buy the game. My apologies to all of the other 29,084 Reviewers.  I just can't help being the best at my gaming reviews, and I'm sorry for stealing everyone's spotlight and making them feel inferior...most likely just overlooked completely though. (Rightfully...but still...I know it must hurt and I can't even imagine what it must feel like as I've never been...well, substandard in any thing that I've done.)  
OH! Almost forgot:  Portal: The Beatles of Escape the Room Puzzle Adventure games. The best, and everyone else that followed took elements of Portal in one way or another.  HEY! Maybe that's why I connect to Portal so deeply and completely! We're both superiors!
One last word to anyone who read this and might now be offended, confused, enraged, or has a scorching case of bitchy-troll:  This was all a freaking joke to anyone who might actually read it.  You know, like a Sarcastic Message-in-a-Bottle?  So, if you were about to write me something rude, condescending or insulting, (or superior! HA!) then I will just be laughing and you'll just make yourself look bad...and stupid...for not picking up on the more complex levels of dark humor, and you make the world aware of this, to boot.
Hey!  
Lighten up! 
B U Y  P O R T A L  and stop wasting all your time reading stuff like THIS when you could be blowing your mind in the world of Aperture...

i think ive played this game for like 2 hours topskis but like its basically portal 2 and i actually confuse the story lines between the portal games because its so difficult and my primitive fish brain is unable to solve the basic puzzles so i come back to each game maybe 6 months inbetween the last time i played it so i retain literally 0 information about it i dont even know which game the potato glados is in it's probably the second one if i had to guess but anyways this game is pretty cool i wish i had gotten it when it mattered like in 2005 ish but i was a little baby

XOXOXO love tim

[h1] Portal [/h1]
Ah que decir de portal es un juego que nacio de un experimento para Half-Life 2 al final se hizo una saga pero portal 2 es para otro momento,La cosa es que un simple experimento que apenas dura 3 Hs termino siendo mejor que muchos juegos actuales bien comenzemos

[h1] El Gameplay [/h1]
El gameplay de Portal es muy simple y con poca evoluciÃ³n pero sus mecanicas hacen que no se requiera una evoluciÃ³n tan grande porque al principio se generan los portales solos luego de unos puzzles consigues el arma de portales azul asi que solo se generan portales naranjas luego consigues el arma de portales naranja y ahora si comienzan los puzzles de verdad como el juego es corto sus puzzles no se explotan del todo y una vez terminas las 19 salas de prueba los puzzles se hacen bastante normales y sin mucha complicacion (te lo esta diciendo alguien que es malo en los puzzles) 

[h1] La Dificultad y Los Puzzles [/h1]

Haber la curva de dificultad es algo que me interesa siempre comentar pero que decir es la clasica curva de dificultad que es facil al principio y dificil al final a un que hay que decir que solo se cumple esa curva de dificultad hasta que terminas las 19 salas de prueba luego hace un bajon impresionante a la dificultad y se hace facil hasta el final se entiende con rapidez estaria mejor un poco mas de desarrollo a nivel de dificultad al menos al final pero esta bien igual

[h1] La Historia [/h1]

La historia de portal es normalita tiene un desarrollo bastante normal,GlaDOS es el unico personaje con el que interactuamos QUE ESTOY DICIENDO SI NI HABLAMOS CON ELLA esto no tiene porque ser malo la verdad se establece una relacion con la misma es un personaje carismatico y con un humor bastante extraÃ±o eso si desde poco despues que nos dan el arma de portales completo se puede ver que algo anda mal. en esa sala literalmente nos ponen con torretas reales,una locura y su final...pues es normalito pero no dire nada al respecto.

Ah y como dato extra la musica de este juego es poca pero perfecta

Portal en definitiva es un juego casi perfecto y es una obra maestra que solo nacio como un experimento que bueno termino en esta cosa que siguio en Portal 2 que ya pronto llegara su reseÃ±a bueno en fin eso es todo gracias por leer esta reseÃ±a.

Nota Final:
9,4/10

fuck this game

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

This is a game, not just any game its the game that changed my life. I know its sounds crazy. This game is a masterpiece, its about a robot who tries to kill you while you escape with a portal gun, what more do you want? So what i mean by it "changed me" is because the first game i got on my xbox 360 was the orange box. Now your probably wondering why half-life 2 or Team Fortress 2 didnt change me. The reason this is because i didnt play half-life 1 and i didnt have xbox live so i couldent play Tf2. I played this on my xbox for probably 50-75 hours on Portal, so this was a great throw back to my first game. So valve please make a portal 3 (witch i know wont happen) i would love that.

This was a triumph
I'm making a note here.
HUGE SUCCESS.
It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.
Aperture sciense.
We do what we must because we can.
For the good of all of us, except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying over every mistake.
You just keep on trying till you run out of cake.
And the Science get's done.
And you make a neat gun.
For the people who are still alive.

I'm not even angry.
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though you broke my heart.
And killed me.
And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because I was so happy for you!
Now these points of data make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta.
We're releasing on time.
So I'm GLaD. I got burned.
Think of all the things we learned for the people who are still alive.

Go ahead and leave me.
I think I prefer to stay inside.
Maybe you'll find someone else to help you.
Maybe Black Mesa.
THAT WAS A JOKE. HA-HA! FAT CHANCE.
Anyway this cake is great, i'ts so delicious and moist.
Look at me still talking when there's Science to do.
When I look out there, it makes me GLaD I'm not you.
I've experiments to run.
There is research to be done on the people who are still alive.

And believe me I am still alive.
I'm doing Science and I'm still alive.
I feel FANTASTIC and I'm still alive.
While you're dying I'll be still alive.
And when you're dead I will be still alive.

STILL ALIVE

STILL ALIVE

Portal has a special place in my heart as it was my first pc game. It taught me how to use a keyboard and mouse while having a great time solving puzzles. The graphics aren't anything to write home about but it adds to Portal's querky personality.   You play as a nameless test subject in Aperture labs who is tasked to finding your way to the end of a series of test rooms with the aide of a portal gun.The game is pretty short and the story is pretty simple. That being said you will have a smile on your face the entire time your playing. Regardless if this is one of your first PC or your 100th game, you will enjoy this game. Definitely worth a buy.
